property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags. When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Care to have a look?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.||1 [Credits]: +1 strength.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[Credits]: +2 strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines.||1 [Credits]: +2 strength.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor

property.name: Rules
property.value: When your turn begins, lose [Click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls... Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[Credits]. When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.||[Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Install only in the root of HQ. 1[Credits]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.

property.name: Rules
property.value: If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[Credits]. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] End the run.||[Subroutine] Pay 1 Credit to let runner encounter rest of subroutines.||[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

property.name: Rules
property.value: If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gain 1[Credits] for each card in the Runner's grip.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?" "Yes. Is that a problem?" "No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal...strictly speaking.

property.name: Rules
property.value: If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength. [Subroutine] End the run. [Subroutine] End the run. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: [Subroutine] End the game. Just kidding.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Black Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trace5 - If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.
